Articles.Content: You know how SAS is what makes your ships turn. Well when you launch a ship, the SAS is disabled. You can press T to toggle it. A blue light will appear behind the SAS icon by your navball. If you don't do this your ship can't turn. The reason it is inactive when you launch is that your ship will always point straight up when it is inactive, so leave it off when you launch until you want to start turning.

When building cargo space-planes, concentrate hard on aesthetics. Ignore all logic & common sense, and don't worry - the better it looks the better it flies! Trust me, I'm a doctor*! 8-]

* not really a doctor.

This is because all space planes are judged on their looks by a panel of kerbals before launch. If a plane scores highly, the pilot's ego will become inflated, increasing the buoyancy of the spacecraft and making it easier to launch.

If your rocket can't SSTO to orbit, you're OBVIOUSLY doing something wrong. Rebuild the rocket and make it SSTO.

Monopropellant is WAY more efficient than liquid fuel! So use your liquid fuel engines such as Mainsails with Monopropellant, they'll be 50% more efficient. If the engine doesn't run with Monopropellant, then your game has a virus and MUST be reinstalled.

Don't send your kerbals into interplanetary space without Cryopods, they're in the "Sci-Fi" tab in the parts menu. If it doesn't appear, make sure you have the "Interplanetary Edition" DLC bought and installed on your game. If you send your kerbals without Cryopods, they'll die of boredom.

Can't find a KSP Forum thread to help you with the issue you're having? Look deeper; there probably is one, but it might be very old.

In that case, post your questions in the oldest suitable thread you can find. This helps keep the forums balanced by recycling old threads to the first page.

If you absolutely must create a new thread, try to give it a cryptic name, and put it in "The Science Labs". That way you will receive help from the

best brains of the forum.

On Topic: Select whatever you picked at the beginning in the VAB/SPH and hit 'w' twice. Then, click launch. It's a cheat that allows you to start in an 80x80km orbit. It doesn't always work, but works most often in Career hardmode.

Whatever you do, DO NOT land on the bluish, flat areas on Minmus that look like frozen-over lakes, because the ice is barely thick enough to support a Kerbal. Also, NEVER listen to anything Scott Manley or the KSP Wiki says. No good players use either of those sources for information.

The Mun's atmosphere is crazy thick, but is only at the last few hundred meters off the surface.

Just fall down; it'll slow you down nicely. (Parachutes MAY be needed for larger craft)
Remember, water is softer than land, so you don't need parachutes to land there!
Delta V is irrelevant, it's all about kilometers per gallon. More kilometers per gallon = more better.

It takes less D/V to go to Eeloo and back than it does the moon. Go to it first in career mode to get the most science and save the most money.
To orbit you only need to fly straight up, and make your acceleration neutral by firing down until your velocity is 0 m/s.
Start off your space program with planes in career mode. Don't have wheels? Use solar panels instead, they'll take the weight.
